pullRequest.body:
Given a series `a‚ÇÄ -r‚Üí a‚ÇÅ -r‚Üí ... -r‚Üí a‚Çô` and an `a` such that `a‚Çô -r‚Üí a` holds, there is
a series of length `n+1`: `a‚ÇÄ -r‚Üí a‚ÇÅ -r‚Üí ... -r‚Üí a‚Çô -r‚Üí a`.

These and some other lemmas in this PR are all extracted from `Order/JordanHolder.lean`

---

nodes.body: `mem_toList` gives a `simpNF` error, so I changed `toList` from `abbrev` to `def`, it seems to make the linter happy, but I am not sure if this is a good way to go.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
bors merge

I pushed a golf
maintainer merge

```suggestion
@[simp] theorem mem_toList {s : RelSeries r} {x : Œ±} : x ‚àà s.toList ‚Üî x ‚àà s := by
```

Could you make that an iff and state it using `Set.Nontrivial` somehow? Maybe
```suggestion
theorem length_pos {s : RelSeries r} : 0 < s.length ‚Üî {x | x ‚àà s}.Nontrivial := by
```
Could you also add `length_ne_zero`?

This lemma fails if `r` is just equality, then `s` can be say `0 = 0 = 0 = 0 ...`, while the right-hand side as a set only has one elements.

Maybe we state the `iff`-lemma with the extra assumption that `r` is irreflexive?
Yes, that makes sense. I assume you're mostly using `RelSeries` of irreflexive relations? or maybe you need `r` to be `‚â§` sometimes?
I need the `\le` version as well. So I will still have two lemmas, 1. Only if direction with no assumption. 2. If and only if with the irreflexivity assumption.

And this could be
```suggestion
theorem length_eq_zero {s : RelSeries r} : s.length = 0 ‚Üî {x | x ‚àà s}.Subsingleton := by
```

```suggestion
lemma mem_snoc {p : RelSeries r} {newLast : Œ±} {rel : r p.last newLast} {x : Œ±} :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/RelSeries): add `snoc` construction

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Order/JordanHolder): use `RelSeries` to implement `CompositionSeries`
